events.event_description: U.S. retail gasoline prices averaged $3.04 per gallon before Thanksgiving, reaching their lowest level since 2020 and 7% lower than the previous year.
events.citation: On the Monday before Thanksgiving, the retail price of regular gasoline averaged $3.04 per gallon (gal) across the United States, 7% less than the same time last year. Retail gasoline prices this Thanksgiving are at their lowest since 2020, when the COVID-19 pandemic disrupted gasoline demand.

events.event_description: AAA forecasts nearly 80 million people will travel for Thanksgiving holiday, representing a 2% increase from 2023.
events.citation: The American Automotive Association (AAA) forecasts nearly 80 million people will travel 50 miles or more for the Thanksgiving holiday, a 2% increase compared with 2023.

events.event_description: Brent crude oil prices average $74 per barrel in November 2024, approximately 10% lower than November 2023, despite OPEC+ production cuts and Middle East tensions.
events.citation: The average Brent crude oil price of $74 per barrel so far this November is about 10% lower than in November last year. Weak growth in global oil demand has helped reduce crude oil prices, even with relatively large production cuts by OPEC+ and geopolitical tensions in the Middle East.

events.event_description: West Coast retail gasoline prices averaged $3.88/gallon, showing a 12% decrease from the previous year.
events.citation: West Coast retail prices on November 25 averaged $3.88/gal, a decrease of 12% compared with the same time last year.

events.event_description: Gulf Coast retail gasoline prices reached $2.64/gallon, the lowest among all regions, down 5% from 2023.
events.citation: On November 25, Gulf Coast retail gasoline prices averaged $2.64/gal, down 5% from the same time last year.
